Salary $24 - $35 per hour

A Bit About Us

The Senior Diesel Mechanic position is a critical role in our company. As a Mechanic, you will be responsible for repairing vehicles and maintaining our fleet of sweeper trucks. No day will be the same as a Mechanic, and opportunities for a pay increase, career growth, and trade growth are second to none. If you're interested in starting a new career, apply below.

This organization maintains a fleet of sweepers, dump trucks, flatbed trucks, pickup trucks, trailers, attenuators, and various other support equipment. This Mechanic position is an experienced mechanic position with opportunities for advancement.

The Diesel Mechanic does need his own tools and ideally 2 years of diesel truck experience. This is a 9-5PM shift with some flexibility and every other Saturday working.



Why join us?


 Competitive wages 401K plan Health, dental, vision, and life insurance Various voluntary benefits like - short-term/long-term disability, accident insurance, critical illness insurance, and additional life insurance Paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick time) A great place to grow your career training, promotion and career paths and advancement Weekly pay on Fridays for hourly positions

Job Details

Responsibilities

 Perform routine and preventative maintenance on street cleaning vehicles, including oil changes, tune-ups, and tire rotations. Diagnose and repair mechanical issues with diesel engines, such as failures or malfunctions. Inspect and maintain the electrical systems of the vehicles, ensuring all components are functioning correctly and safely. Work with a variety of maintenance tools to repair or replace faulty parts. Conduct regular inspections of street cleaning vehicles to ensure they meet all safety standards and regulations. Maintain accurate records of each vehicle's maintenance and repair history. Collaborate with team members to troubleshoot complex mechanical issues and develop effective solutions. Provide recommendations for improving the efficiency and performance of the vehicles. Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, techniques, and technology to ensure the highest level of service.

Qualifications

 Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Diesel Mechanic or in a similar role. Proficient in working with maintenance tools, diesel engines, vehicle electrical systems, and gasoline engines. Comprehensive understanding of the mechanical and electrical components of street cleaning vehicles. Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose and repair mechanical issues quickly and effectively. Strong attention to detail with the ability to maintain accurate records. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Commitment to adhering to all safety standards and regulations. Ability to work independently and manage time effectively. Current and valid driver's license. ASE Diesel Certification or equivalent is preferred.

Join our team and contribute to the cleanliness and safety of our city streets. Apply today!
